importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news article indicates the most recent incident involving a fire caused by a woman attempting to kill a cockroach, highlighting current social trends and public safety concerns in South Korea.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The incident occurred on a specific day, Monday, indicating the exact timeframe in which the fire started and the escape attempt took place.

keyTakeAways: A woman in her 20s in Osan, South Korea, attempted to kill a cockroach using a homemade flamethrower made from a lighter and flammable spray, which resulted in a fire that spread to her apartment block.
The fire caused a resident, a Chinese national in her 30s, to fall from a window during a failed evacuation attempt, leading to her death.

The couple, including the deceased woman, tried to escape through a window because thick smoke blocked the stairway, and the husband managed to escape to the next building, while the woman fell and died.
Eight other residents suffered smoke inhalation due to the fire.
The incident reflects a dangerous trend of using improvised flamethrowers to kill cockroaches, popularized by social media content.
In 2018, an Australian man similarly set fire to his kitchen using a homemade flamethrower, showing a global pattern of such risky behaviors.
South Korean police believe the woman may be charged with accidental fire starting and causing death by negligence.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A woman in her 20s in Osan, South Korea, attempted to kill a cockroach using a homemade flamethrower made from a lighter and flammable spray, which ignited a fire in her apartment building. The fire spread, forcing residents to attempt escape through windows due to smoke blocking the stairway. A Chinese national in her 30s, living on the fifth floor, fell from a window during the escape and died; her husband survived and reached the next building. Eight other residents suffered smoke inhalation. Police believe the woman may be charged with negligence, as her method—popularized by social media—demonstrates a dangerous trend in pest control, with similar incidents reported globally, such as in Australia in 2018.
title: South Korea: Woman trying to kill cockroach sets apartment block on fire
